discussion.content:
Definition: An RTM is a document that links requirements throughout the validation process. It ensures that all requirements defined for a system are tested in the test protocols.
Purpose: It helps in tracking the completeness of the project by mapping user requirements to the deliverables produced.
Functionality: The RTM allows the project team to trace each requirement to its corresponding design elements, development tasks, and testing cases.

questions.question_text: A development team, which is working on a software project, demonstrates software functionality to project stakeholders a week before the implementation date. Several stakeholders comment that the software does not meet the communicated expectations. Which of the following tools should the project manager use to validate the functionality?
Following the approval of a change by the CCB, which of the following should a project manager consider NEXT when deploying a new networking device into an existing production environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A: Maintenance Window, would be scheduled to ensure minimal downtime to implement the change since it does not state time is critical for this change to occur.

Both a Risk Assessment and Operational Security Assessment would have been conducted prior to going to the CCB for consideration. 

While a Validation check is done after the change is implemented to ensure its function.

questions.question_text: During the stabilization phase for recently deployed software, an end user reports a bug that is compromising data integrity. Which of the following tools will the project manager MOST likely use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A defect log is used in software development when defects (or bugs) are found during testing and after release. (pg 327 - "The Official CompTIA Project+ Guide (PK0-005)"

Selected Answer: A
ANSWER A:

When you see “MOST likely use” in the context of PMBOK®:

"Issue log" is the recognized, broad repository for ANYTHING requiring resolution.

"Defect log" is not a PMBOK® artifact, even though it’s common in software development.

"Change log" tracks the status of change requests once they’ve been formally submitted and accepted or rejected.

"Task board" (or Kanban board) can be used in Agile or hybrid environments, but it’s more of a visual management tool for tasks and workflow—less about formally registering a problem that requires escalation or resolution in a PMBOK® sense.

Hence, from the PMI/PMBOK® perspective, “Issue log” is the correct place to record any new bug or data‐integrity problem that arises.

Selected Answer: B
A would be for issues that arise in a project over all B is specifically for software projects, which the question states that it is.

TheFai that is because there is no such log. We have trolls in this forum and it is very concerning, because we are actually trying to obtain information to pass and move on.
Table 1.1 Project Management Documents. Change and Issue log...

Selected Answer: A
I cannot find the verbiage Defect Log anywhere in my Sybex book. Issue Log is mentioned repeatedly however, and is used for this exact case.

Selected Answer: B
CompTIA Project+ Study Guide, 3rd Edition
Chapter 4: Planning the Project

"The user stories are prioritized so that the most important are at the top of the backlog list and those with less importance fall beneath these on the list."

The team should prioritize backlog items based on their significance to the project’s success.
Therefore B is the correct choice.

questions.question_text: A team is analyzing the backlog in order to decide what to include in the next sprint. Which of the following aspects is the MOST important for the team to take into consideration?

choices.A: Medical record and test result values

questions.question_text: Which of the following pieces of data are examples of PII?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
A and D are both PHI not PII

B and C could both be considered PII, but C is the more correct answer.

Selected Answer: B
B and C are considered PII. C is the choice that jumps out more, but B could be a possibility. You can connect an individua to an email address and an IP address.

Selected Answer: C
PII stands for Personally Identifiable Information, which refers to any data that could potentially identify a specific individual. Examples of PII include:

C. Name and year of birth

Both the name and year of birth are pieces of information that can be used, either separately or together, to identify a specific individual.

Selected Answer: C
C 
NAME AND YEAR OF BIRTH
